text: Strengths of Shell Scripting compared to Python
I tried to learn shell(bash) scripting few times but was driven away by the syntax.
Then I found Python and was able to do most of the things a shell script can do in Python.
I am now not sure whether I should invest my time in learning shell scripting anymore.
What are strengths of shell scripting that make it an indispensable tool as compared to Python?
I am not a system administration by profession, but I am interested in setting up Linux systems for home users, hence I think learning shell scripting can become necessary.
